text: Any idea which field I would use to give the end user the ability to choose 1.) what social media link they'd like to use, and 2.) the link destination (top left of screenshot).
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
you'd use choice but with a "destination" in the option pairings: <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-modules#choice>
so you'd set the "value1" as the "<http://facebook.com/company>" and the "Label 1" as "Facebook" or some such

Is it the beta module editor that is tripping me up? I go through all of the steps in creating the choices, values, etc. And when I copy the snippet it outputs `{{ module.choice_field }}` In theory I should have 3 unique snippets so the user can choose which social icons they would like, and where they would like them to go...

Ah, you're referencing a custom module then? They have limited options for using variables within them (though if I'm not mistaken, there is a push to open this up and include more options / settings for them when creating variables). I was referencing the use of the "choice" module within a template directly (via HubL) and not within the context of a "custom module"
